messages.message:
How have people been tracking where a user comes from for the back buttons in AI Hub so far?

Context: I'm allowing users to click straight into a deployment from the review tab in workspaces now, which means that clicking back from a deployment should take you back to the review tab if that is where you came from. At the moment, its hard-coded to take users back to the deploy tab in workspaces.

I think a common way is adding where the user came from in the location state, but wondering if we do this anywhere else already or another method has been used?

Although I'm using a pollen `Link` component here and making the `as` prop a `Link` tab from react-router. As a result, its not letting me add a `state` prop to the link right now anyways :sweat_smile: so have to get around that first

So the user visits: review tab in workspaces → deployment.
When user clicks the back button, we want to go the to deploy tab in workspaces instead of the review tab?
I think it was Paul who implemented `returnUrl` for handling this situation in deployments - there's an example in webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/apps/src/aihub/pages/Workspaces/deploy/index.tsx

the human review page also takes in a `prevUrl` query argument that we use to take the user back to a ground truth set page if they’re editing a ground truth set

see https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/webserver/shared/src/js/webpack[…]/aihub/hooks/appAccuracy/useRedirectGroundTruthToHumanReview.ts (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/apps/src/aihub/hooks/appAccuracy/useRedirectGroundTruthToHumanReview.ts)

@Xindi Xu nope, the user should go back to where they came from so review -> deployment, back button should take user to review.

I'll look into the options Jessica and Serena mentioned though, Thank you!
